alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 9:27PM EDT until April 10 at 9:42PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Elliston....and at Edwardsport down to Petersburg. .Following areas of one to two inches of rainfall on Wednesday... lowland, minor flooding along the East Fork White River...continues at Seymour...while on the White River minor flooding has resumed at Elliston...and continues at Edwardsport and points downriver. The crest on the East Fork White River has passed Seymour...yet this slowly passing crest is expected to hold Lawrence County points in action stage to near bankfull into early next week. The White River is forecast to crest this weekend. Flooding is expected to continue on the East Fork White River at Seymour into Saturday...while aforementioned points on the White River should remain in minor flood into next week. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. Dry conditions are expected through next week... which will allow the lowest portions of the White River to crest and fall below flood by next weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Edwardsport. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Flooding closes Old Vincennes Road. High water crosses SR 358 on the Daviess County side just west of the levee. Flooding begins to affect higher bottomlands. Residential property of river cabins begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Thursday /6:00 PM CDT Thursday/ the stage was 16.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EDT Thursday /6:00 PM CDT Thursday/ was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.5 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by noon Friday.
